definition: To do something or perform in a play or film; a deed or a main section of a play.
examples: The class will act out the story. (verb)
My favourite act in the play is Act Two. (noun)

extra.memory_tip: Act = action—either doing something or a part of a play.

definition: Extra; added to what already exists.
examples: You may bring one additional book.
We need additional time to finish.

extra.memory_tip: Additional = in addition to what you have.

definition: Ideas or suggestions about what someone should do.
examples: My teacher gave me good advice about revising.
Ask a doctor’s advice if you feel unwell.

extra.memory_tip: Advice (noun) gives you ideas; advise (verb) is to give advice.

definition: To crush something into a wrinkled mass or to collapse inwards.
examples: He crumpled the paper into a ball.
The empty can crumpled underfoot.

definition: A device or person that moves air; someone who admires something; to wave to cool or to stir up.
examples: The fan kept the room cool. (noun)
Crowds fanned themselves in the heat. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Fan can blow air or be a big admirer.

definition: To learn something so well that you can remember it exactly.
examples: We memorised the poem for assembly.
Try to memorise your times tables.

extra.memory_tip: Memorise = make it part of your memory.

definition: To confuse someone by making something hard to understand.
examples: The puzzle mystified the class.
Strange footprints mystified the ranger.

definition: A short stop; to stop for a short time before continuing.
examples: There was a brief pause before the music. (noun)
Pause the video while I take notes. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Pause = press the pause button in real life.

definition: Allowing light to pass through so objects can be seen clearly; easy to understand or detect.
examples: The jar is made of transparent glass.
The rules are transparent and fair.

extra.memory_tip: Transparent = you can ‘see through’ the material or the meaning.

examples: The magician made the coin vanish.
Rain clouds vanished by afternoon.
